Hunters don't know why the Lightning Rod mouse wants to be electrified, but common sense dictates that they should be avoided when a storm is brewing.

cowardly.name: Cowardly
cowardly.description: Traumatized by its terrible experience with a Swiss Army Trap (in a nightmare it had once), the Cowardly mouse sees constant menace in its idyllic surroundings. To this neurotic little rodent, every blade of grass represents a potentially fatal paper cut, and every rose a debilitating eye injury caused by getting too close for a sniff, followed by a bird landing on the bush at the the wrong moment, which causes the thorns to. . . well, you get the picture.

field.name: Field
field.description: After finding a tuft of grass in a private location, usually by a nice view, visitors to Gnawnia and the Meadow often decide to spread out blankets and have a picnic. Unfortunately,  when they try to sit down, they realize that their feast is being carried off by a multitude of mice who have posed as grass to lure them in. Because of these recent scams, the King has advised the public to be extra wary of scenic vistas, charming fruit groves, and any and all topiary.

mole.name: Mole
mole.description: These partially blind little fellows find their way through the earth by feeling around, making them more susceptible to getting caught. The Digby development in the Burroughs aided their efforts to push past the Mountain into the Gnawnia region. Due to the dirt in their nostrils, they have a harder time sniffing out cheese.

master_of_the_cheese_belt.name: Master of the Cheese Belt
master_of_the_cheese_belt.description: Masters of the Cheese Belt have learned to channel their hunger for cheese into pure strength. By focusing on their teachings, these masters are often able to overpower physical traps with great ease.

master_of_the_cheese_claw.name: Master of the Cheese Claw
master_of_the_cheese_claw.description: Masters of the Cheese Claw fear no adversary, yearning for a worthy enough challenger to dare face them. With the slightest touch, they can concentrate enough force to destroy any obstacle. Though accomplished masters of their fighting style, they train ceaselessly, seeking to continue improving their abilities.

master_of_the_cheese_fang.name: Master of the Cheese Fang
master_of_the_cheese_fang.description: Nimble and agile, Masters of the Cheese Fang have perfected their weaponry skills. Their small stature and incredible speed make these mice near impossible to catch.

abominable_snow.name: Abominable Snow
abominable_snow.description: Abominable Snow mice are far from bashful. They love to play innocent pranks that always seem to involve pelting others with a barrage of snowballs. These mice are occasionally seen wandering down from the Mountains to give hunters a hard time.

frosty_snow.name: Frosty Snow
frosty_snow.description: The mouse on top of this little arrangement is the architect of a rather ingenious pyramid scheme. You see, he managed to convince the other two that if they agreed to roll themselves into the bigger snowballs at the bottom of the snowman, they would receive a commission of cheese in a matter of four to six weeks. Of course, there wasn't really any cheese. . . only a carrot, and there's only room for one carrot on a snowman.

frozen.name: Frozen
frozen.description: This mouse thought that its lucky day had finally come around when it saw a giant wedge of cheese floating on the surface of a freezing lake, but unfortunately, that's where the Frozen Mouse's luck ended. Because it's surrounded in a shield of solid ice, the other mice give it all the dirtiest jobs to do. The Frozen Mouse's latest job is to sit on traps and catch the mechanisms as they spring, which makes it wish for the season of spring all the more.

pebble.name: Pebble
pebble.description: Thoughtful thieves to the last, Pebble Mice have the innate ability to determine the weight of things. They spend most of their time on the vast mountainside, looking for pebbles of just the right size, shape, and weight. When they encounter a trap, they very carefully use these pebbles to replace the cheese, which fools the trap into thinking that the cheese is still there. Obviously, this tactic garners mixed results, depending on the sophistication of the trap.

blacksmith.name: Blacksmith
blacksmith.description: These mice forge various tools from scraps of metal they find. Their most recent ambitions include harnessing the power of Simple Orbs to produce heat to power their smelting furnaces.

desert_architect.name: Desert Architect
desert_architect.description: The ambitions of these architects far exceed their technical abilities, which often results in dangerously unstable structures. Desert Architect mice are known for their determination and resolve, making it hard to distract them from their work long enough to visit a trap. The magical scent of SUPER|brie+ is the only known means to attracting them to benefit from the abundance of loot they carry.

desert_nomad.name: Desert Nomad
desert_nomad.description: These mice wander the Sandtail Desert shrouded in mystery. Due to their stealth and rarity, Nomad mice infrequently cross paths with a hunter's trap. They can occasionally be found in market locations looking for supplies for their next epic journey.

falling_carpet.name: Falling Carpet
falling_carpet.description: These mice are often seen plummeting from the sky toward a hunter's bait. It's unclear if their intentions are to damage traps with a collision, or if they simply forget to "pull-up" in time. Despite their air-acrobatics, one thing is clear: Falling from the sky is often not favourable for the mouse.

glass_blower.name: Glass Blower
glass_blower.description: Despite their small stature, these mice have an amazing lung capacity, making them experts at crafting molten glass.

limestone_miner.name: Limestone Miner
limestone_miner.description: These mice originally dwelled in dark caverns and caves, always on the lookout for a rich deposit of limestone. When they discovered humans use limestone as a building material, some focused their efforts on mining walls, floors and ceilings, posing a serious threat to the structural integrity of a building.

lumberjack.name: Lumberjack
lumberjack.description: Coconut trees were already hard to find in the Sandtail Desert; however, once these mice began wandering the sands, the trees became almost non-existent! Once they have split the bark with a hatchet, these mice can chew through a tree trunk in a matter of seconds.

mage_weaver.name: Mage Weaver
mage_weaver.description: Using their enchanted looms, these seamstress mice produce delicate mage cloth at an astonishing speed. As each sheet of fabric is completed, Mage Weaver mice release an ionized charge from enchanted orbs to magically transport their product to an unknown location.

market_guard.name: Market Guard
market_guard.description: The presence of these guards is greatly concerning to shopkeepers in Muridae; The mice have become so comfortable in the market that they have started to defend it as if it were their own territory! These swordsmice serve to both protect the market from human intruders as well as fend off any less-than-noble thief mice.

market_thief.name: Market Thief
market_thief.description: These thieves are the source of frustration and gloom as they effortlessly steal supplies from merchants' stalls. Their speed and strength make them difficult to catch and enable them to often steal supplies from underprepared hunters. In fact, these are the only mice able to steal from hunters in the Muridae Market!

pie_thief.name: Pie Thief
pie_thief.description: Cunning and swift, the Pie Thief mouse frequently visits window ledges looking for baked desserts. Where they take all the pies and what they do with so many remains a mystery.

snake_charmer.name: Snake Charmer
snake_charmer.description: These musically-inclined mice believe they have found an enchanted tune to charm the dangerous snakes native to the Sandtail Desert. Unfortunately, their music only seems to increase a snake's appetite.

spice_merchant.name: Spice Merchant
spice_merchant.description: With a pinch of this and a dash of that, these mice can give flavour to even the most bland varieties of cheese. Business is booming for them in the Sandtail Desert where the arid heat often dries out cheese.

alnilam.name: Alnilam
alnilam.description: The Alnilam mouse does not hunt with speed nor stealth. Their ancient "technique" involves running out from the trees, yelling loudly, while brandishing a well-sharpened spear. The sight of dozens of these hunters running and screaming in unison is one of the most unique sights on the island.

beast_tamer.name: Beast Tamer
beast_tamer.description: With incredible patience, the Beast Tamer mouse bends the wills of the mighty creatures which dwell in the nearby jungle. The mighty beasts that this mouse tames are used to carry supplies and work within the Nerg village.

conjurer.name: Conjurer
conjurer.description: Using strange dance rituals and musical instruments, the Conjurer mice are a magical focal point for the Nerg Tribe. Their magic is said to protect the tribe from foreign attacks and destroy the luck of MouseHunters.

conqueror.name: Conqueror
conqueror.description: The Conqueror mouse is trained to attack with brutal force, disarming and destroying traps. Failing to capture this mouse often leaves hunters' courage crippled. The Nerg tribe relies on these warriors to expand their territory and explore new lands.

defender.name: Defender
defender.description: The greatest warrior of the mighty Nerg tribe guards the village from not only enemy tribes and hunters, but also any strange creatures that wander in from the jungle. Their roar shakes the tree tops and is mistaken for thunder amongst the residents of Gnawnia.

finder.name: Finder
finder.description: The Finder mouse possesses heightened senses, able to see, smell and hear things from a great distance. Their skills and speed serve them well in gathering supplies for the Nerg.

nerg_chieftain.name: Nerg Chieftain
nerg_chieftain.description: The smallest mouse of the Nerg Tribe serves as their leader. Incapable of normal means of communication, the leader shouts orders by rambling insane gibberish that has proven to be as intimidating as it is confusing.

slayer.name: Slayer
slayer.description: At one with the environment, the nimble Slayer mouse can command the forces of nature. Hurling large rocks, boulders and branches, this mouse is well-practiced in reducing traps into piles of rubble.

dojo_sensei.name: Dojo Sensei
dojo_sensei.description: Rarely seen, these wise old mice instruct the Dojo Masters from the shadows, lest their presence be known to MouseHunters. Hunting these mice is not for the faint of heart -- their swift attacks can leave the courage of even the most steadfast hunter extremely crippled. Hunters who take on the challenge of catching a Dojo Sensei and succeed are held in the highest regard, for they have conquered the forces of the Furoma region.

master_of_the_dojo.name: Master of the Dojo
master_of_the_dojo.description:
As experts in all forms of traditional Furoma combat, the Masters of the Dojo rule their region with an iron fist, enslaving both mice and hunters as servants. Few mice dare challenge the power of a Dojo Master and even fewer hunters dare to hunt these near unstoppable mice.



Never has the need for Grandmaster Hunters been higher as the Furoma mice plot to overthrow the King of Gnawnia!

moussile.name: Moussile
moussile.description: Locked and loaded!  The Moussile Mouse looks all poised for flight but something doesn't look quite right.  Staring up to the sky intently, he seems to be waiting for something...

rockstar.name: Rockstar
rockstar.description: With a guitar in one paw and a mic in the other, catching this mouse will earn you one of the most face-melting rock experiences ever!! Lore warns that listening to this mouse play guitar could cause your ears to melt off and your head to explode in an awesome frenzy of excitement! "But I like Rhythm and Blues" you say? No! You have to listen to ROCK MUSIC. Haha, just kidding, you can listen to anything you want! ROCK ON! *wailing guitars*

bottled.name: Bottled
bottled.description: These mice cleverly survived the sinking of the S.S. Huntington I by setting sail in empty bottles of the King's Reserve Bubbleh. Seemingly content to drift wherever the winds and currents take them, only their murmurs and ramblings reveal their madness...

briegull.name: Briegull
briegull.description: These bizarre creatures swarm hunters' traps along the waterfront in search of a cheesy meal. They are worth little reward and their appearance annoys most hunters.

buccaneer.name: Buccaneer
buccaneer.description: Quick to draw their sword at the first sight of cheese, the Buccaneer mouse has a reputation for looting bait from even the quickest of traps! Fear their presence most when they are amongst their Pirate shipmates, for their steel is strengthened in greater numbers.

captain.name: Captain
captain.description: Fearsome, deadly with a sword, and loyally followed by Pirate and Buccaneer mice, the Captain mouse is not to be underestimated. This mouse will not only swipe your cheese without a trace; it will leave your trap feeling morally wounded, traumatically scarred, and ruefully defeated... and it's an inanimate object! If you cross paths with this mouse, hope that it's long after its trail has gone cold.

cook.name: Cook
cook.description: A connoisseur of all things cheesy, the Cook mouse is responsible for feeding their hungry shipmates. Not known for being open to criticism, those who complain of their cooking often find themselves being tossed through a port window en route to an unexpected swim.

leviathan.name: Leviathan
leviathan.description: Leviathan mice wait just below the surface of the water for passing ships. Using their size and power, these feared monsters crush ships and drag their cheesy cargo to the bottom of the ocean.

mermouse.name: Mermouse
mermouse.description: The Mermouse is an incredibly shy breed that avoids hunters as well as other mice. Its timid nature makes it very rare and hard to find.

salt_water_snapper.name: Salt Water Snapper
salt_water_snapper.description: The Salt Water Snapper mouse swims silently through the water waiting for the perfect moment to pounce upon a hunter's cheese. They may lack the multitude of teeth that their close cousins have, but they'll snap down with equal, if not greater, force when cheese is nearby.

shelder.name: Shelder
shelder.description: Incredibly wise, this Elder mouse has learned from centuries of avoiding traps. In its later years, it now avoids the busy hunting grounds of Gnawnia and soothes its aching bones with the warm salt waters of the sunny ocean. As wise and scarce as the Shelder Mouse is, even this timid and peaceful mouse gets hungry for a snack now and then...

siren.name: Siren
siren.description: The Siren mouse sings a song that welcomes hunters to a grim, watery fate. Never have jagged, sharp rocks sounded so good!

squeaken.name: Squeaken
squeaken.description: The Squeaken mouse projects an air of menace as it stalks ships on the open water. Its powerful limbs toss hunters' traps aside and quickly grab the fresh cheese.

swabbie.name: Swabbie
swabbie.description: Forced to clean up after its shipmates, the Swabbie mouse is an under-appreciated pirate wannabe. This poor, hapless servant faces daily humiliation from his fellow seafarers.

king_grub.name: King Grub
king_grub.description:
This oversized grub has refused to morph into its true form. Instead, it continues to consume and increase its mass to an alarming size. This self-declared King rules through fear in the Sand Crypt, commanding other mice to bring him food and defend his lair at all costs. Luckily for him, the mice fear him more than they do a hunter's trap - plus it's not too hard to swipe the cheese without the King Grub mouse knowing.

Being a gigantic grub is about the equivalent to being a gigantic baby - not too smart but prone to loud and sometimes dangerous tantrums. Mice steer clear of him as best as they can, which is okay because he prefers it that way.

The short of all this, is that you'll never attract the King Grub to your trap without liberally slathering it with an appealing scent to attract him, and you'll never defeat him without heavily salting your trap for an added boost.

king_scarab.name: King Scarab
king_scarab.description:
Normally, Grubling Mice pupate into Scarab Mice. The King Grub however, has refused to hatch for so long that the rapid transformation induced by the Shattering Charm caused him to mutate into a horrifying scarab monstrosity. Much more powerful now, only the most foolish or brave of hunters would dare face this terrifying foe, but this transformation may have been for the best. If the Grub King were left to continue eating Garden Essences, he would have surely have been impossible to face later.

Your trap will be a lot less effective against the Scarab King, given all of his armour. To face him you'll need a lot more salt, not to mention an extreme disregard for your personal safety.

sand_colossus.name: Sand Colossus
sand_colossus.description:
Centuries ago, an infamous hunter used a unique and terrible trap to capture the very souls of mice and confine them in gemstones. When the rest of the world found out, the hunter was banished and his name and the details of his trap were erased from history.

In the intervening years, the mice have started breaking free from the gemstones and using the very sand around them to craft a monstrous form. Be careful hunting these mice down! They've already been caught once before and are twice as prepared!

sarcophamouse.name: Sarcophamouse
sarcophamouse.description:
There are two kinds of Sarcophamouses you'll run across during your travels: The kind that were entombed in ancient times and now roam the desert crypts mindlessly, and the kind that were wrapped up in toilet paper and tossed in a cheap plastic sarcophagus as a mean-spirited prank.

Both kinds are equally angry and equally dangerous, so watch out!

scarab.name: Scarab
scarab.description:
The glittering blue, gold, and red carapace of the Scarab Mouse is a natural beauty nearly unmatched in the world. Growing such incredible protection requires incredible amounts of energy, which is why Grubling Mice - who are the Scarab Mouse's previous form - require so much food so quickly.

Scarab Mice are fast, strong, and brilliant. Only their small size prevents them from being a serious problem. A really large Scarab Mouse would be very dangerous indeed!

serpentine.name: Serpentine
serpentine.description:
Be careful on your travels when you see long, winding tracks in the sand! Odds are good a poisonous Serpentine Mouse is nearby, buried under the sand and ready to spring!

While the Serpentine Mouse is dangerous when provoked, it prefers cheese over any other food, and will prefer to raid a nearby trap for its dinner, so be sure to keep your trap stocked with tasty cheese!

dunehopper.name: Dunehopper
dunehopper.description: These tiny mice are exceptionally quick, and only determined and resourceful hunters will ever catch them in their traps.  They nest in the practically impenetrable Tuono Basin area, and then roam the dunes for food, running across the sands with their unmistakable "pop-hop" gait.

grubling_herder.name: Grubling Herder
grubling_herder.description:
Grubling Herders are a solemn and insular group, trained from birth to direct and control the voracious Grubling mice away from vital crops. They hail from a place of shadow known only as "Muddy'Deeb", and dedicate their lives to ensuring the rampage of the Grubling mice remains under their control.

The Grublings must flow!

grubling.name: Grubling
grubling.description:
Aw, what a cute little horror! Tiny little Grubling Mice may be adorable, but they're sort of rare, and a good thing, too. They race around in a literal stampede from food source to food source, absolutely devouring everything they find, and cannot be attracted to your trap by mere cheese alone. No, you'll have to find some form of charm to attract them during a stampede - perhaps in the shape of their favourite food?

Although they're cute now, Grubling Mice that can secure enough food build themselves a charming little cocoon and slowly morph into the far more dangerous Scarab Mouse, so catch as many as you can now to help keep the population in check!

quesodillo.name: Quesodillo
quesodillo.description:
With its extra-hard shell, the Quesodillo Mouse can trigger nearly any trap and then just roll into a ball to avoid it.

Note that the Quesodillo Mouse doesn't just use this ability for survival. Notable explorers have seen them gleefully rolling down sand dunes, then scurrying back up just to do it again and again.

sand_pilgrim.name: Sand Pilgrim
sand_pilgrim.description: These tiny mice roam the dunes in ones and twos, mute except for the songs they sing to each other.  No-one really knows what their goal or destination is, or why they feel compelled to roam.  Perhaps they're seeking something, or perhaps they're running from something.  Or perhaps it's just for the love of the journey.

spiky_devil.name: Spiky Devil
spiky_devil.description: More frustrating than scary, these little devils are playful pranksters, often leaving tiny piles of sand in place of the cheese they steal from traps.  Their thick, spiky skin protects them well from a wide variety of trap powers, and their sensitive tongues allow them to "smell out" improperly or sloppily-baited traps with ease.

bruticle.name: Bruticle
bruticle.description: The Bruticle Mouse tackles all of its opponents head-on, using its extreme strength to overpower them before delivering a blast of ice that traps them in place. If the ability to throw ice isn't enough to gain the Bruticle their prize, they have a ready back-up weapon in the blanket of spikes on their back. These spikes, like a porcupine's quills, can be ripped out and used as spears, or, in emergencies, used as a spike shield between mouse and Hunter.

derpicorn.name: Derpicorn
derpicorn.description: The slender physique and fierce personality of the Unicorn Mouse makes it an ideal cheese predator. It defends its territory with its deadly horn, ready to pounce on any cheese carrier and-- what? I'm describing Zugzwang's Derpicorn Mouse? Oh dear. Well gentle reader, there is only one thing to know about the Derpicorn. Produce cheese, and its will is yours to command, assuming that you are on an errand that requires a rotund white mouse. As for the Unicorn Mouse, that's just impossible.

fall_familiar.name: Fall Familiar
fall_familiar.description: The dry rustle of leaves blowing in the wind accompanies the passing of the Fall Familiar, bringing with it the smell of lit jack-o-lanterns. The sky is always a little dusky as it roams the garden, which provides ample cover for his minions to rob hunters attempting to track him. Although it never usually gets its gnarled paws dirty with such things, the Fall Familiar is quite an accomplished thief, able to turn into a swirl of dead leaves if it is in danger of being caught.

firebreather.name: Firebreather
firebreather.description: Some mice use fire for the sake of wanton destruction, but to the Firebreather mouse, destruction is an art. One graceful puff from their torch, and your cheese is fondue. Another spiraling fireball later, your pants are on fire. Then, after a flourish and a wave of the paw, there's a ring of flame around you that you're not sure how to get rid of. Not surprisingly, Hunters' lore advises all visitors to the Summer island to skip the Firebreather's floor show.

firefly.name: Firefly
firefly.description: Firefly mice are harder to catch than you might think, given that they only come out at night, and that they have a lit bulb attached to their rear end. Like their insect inspiration, these mice keep their lights on just long enough to distract any potential pursuit, then blink out as they dive for the cheese. Fireflies also use their bulbous bottoms as blinding devices, flooding more advanced traps' sensors with sudden bursts of light.

frostbite.name: Frostbite
frostbite.description: Sharp as the biting wind on a January morning, the Frostbite mouse embodies the cold of a deep, northern winter. Frost feeds its powers, allowing it to use the magic of Zugzwang's garden to become stronger and sharper than ever before. At the peak of its power, the Frostbite mouse's claws become as hard as diamonds, and freeze their victims on contact. Don't expect any fear from a Frostbite mouse, either-- their disposition is as unyielding as a glacier.

harvest_harrier.name: Harvest Harrier
harvest_harrier.description: Despite its colorful cloak of autumn leaves, and charming hat made of a mini-pumpkin top, this mouse is a master of evasion. The Harvest Harrier's job is to remain invisible, in order to spring as many traps and rob as many traps as possible, and it takes this duty seriously. Catch a glimpse of it in the pumpkin patch, and it turns into just another gourd, quick as a blink. Spot it in a leaf pile, and, well, good luck finding it again.

harvester.name: Harvester
harvester.description: The Harvester Mouse expresses the dominant traits of fall: plant death and  hibernation. Although its primary concern is the changing of the seasons, it uses its powers of hibernation against Hunters and traps without hesitation, putting them both into a deep sleep which lasts until spring. Beware the Harvester's sleep spell: With a single, mis-measured blast, Hunters have fallen asleep in their youth and awakened with wrinkled faces.

hot_head.name: Hot Head
hot_head.description: Wherever the summer sun beats down on fields and beaches, there are mice who love the heat, frolicking in the fields... and then, there are the inevitable casualties. Hot Head mice had a little too much fun in the sun, and now they're left bright pink, woozy, and more than a little confused. Since melty cheese is sometimes used as a sunscreen, they're storming traps to get some, but they're not in any condition to be walking, let alone stealing.

hydrophobe.name: Hydrophobe
hydrophobe.description: Most mice living in Zugzwang's garden have some desire to fit into their seasonal area, but the Hydrophobe mouse proves a rare exception to the rule. To a Hydrophobe, wet fur is a misery, and so they seek shelter under anything they can find (leaves, roots, a looming Deathbot) in order to dodge mother nature's attacks on their well-being. Their dislike for spring rain is so strong, in fact, that it counteracts the seasonal magic.

icicle.name: Icicle
icicle.description: Unlike common icicles, which hang from eaves troughs and mind their own business, the razor-sharp ice spears controlled by the Icicle mouse fly through the air in a swarm, waiting like a raised dagger for hunters to come along and set out their cheese. Once the trap is set, the Icicle mouse drops a barrage of icy spears on trap and hunter, slicing their clothing, sending the cheese flying, and, worst of all, running down the hunter's shirt. Brrr!

monarch.name: Monarch
monarch.description: Without any real powers to play with, the Monarch Mouse decided to improvise in order to fit in with its transformed comrades. It pilfered materials from nearby hunters, acquired wings from a butterfly using methods better left un-described, and transformed itself into the self-proclaimed ruler of the insects. So far, its attempts to herd beetles have proved unsuccessful, but the padding on its costume does absorb the impact from some traps.

over-prepared.name: Over-Prepared
over-prepared.description: As in most areas where extreme weather is an issue, some mice embrace the snow, and some... prepare for snowpocalypse. The Over-prepared mouse is convinced that soon, the world will be covered in mountains of wintery death, and so it covered itself in layers of warm clothing. Because it is nothing if not thorough, it has also got an enviable arsenal of trap-busting tools stashed away in that suit, when it can find them among all the layers.

penguin.name: Penguin
penguin.description: When Penguin mice decided to get up a spiffy costume and imitate their favorite winter bird, they didn't count on a few of the limitations inherent in their disguise. They were looking forward to sliding down icy slopes, using only their tummies as a sled, and swimming through icy water. Unfortunately, rubberized canvas and cotton batting don't take to these activities as readily as one would hope, resulting in many a sliced-up suit.

puddlemancer.name: Puddlemancer
puddlemancer.description: Do not underestimate this mouse by its portly appearance and purple-flower-deelybopper headband. This mouse... is a Master of the art of puddle manipulation. All it needs is a small pool of last night's muddy rainwater to wreak dewy destruction on all who oppose it, hurling drops of water at traps with such great speed that it can slap the cheese right off of the trap base. The flowers are just for camouflage. Yes, camouflage...

pumpkin_head.name: Pumpkin Head
pumpkin_head.description: There are three distinct steps to pumpkin carving: draw the face, scoop the seeds, then carve. The Pumpkin Head mice, in a fit of eagerness to fit in with their transformed brethren, got a little confused during this process. Since they stuck their heads into the pumpkin before carving began, they were in no hurry to go under the knife, even if it meant a slight loss of visibility.

scarecrow.name: Scarecrow
scarecrow.description: While the Scarecrow Mouse's seasonal transformation may not summon lightning or turn its foes to ice, it presents just as much of a threat to the unprepared Hunter. The Scarecrow's most valuable talent is its ability to be squashed and torn without losing much of its original vitality, meaning that very few traps have much effect on it. The best way to get rid of a Scarecrow is to scatter its stuffing-- once its straw is all gone, it will be too floppy to carry on.

spring_familiar.name: Spring Familiar
spring_familiar.description: Clad in churning billows of cloud, the Spring Familiar brings a concentrated electrical storm with it wherever it goes. When this mouse enters the area, take cover- it may look serene, but the lightning bolts shooting out of its skirt will fry any trap mechanism in its path. Like a slow-moving thunderhead, the Spring Familiar is never in a hurry. It knows that it can take its time pilfering and eating cheese, because hunters fear its shocking defenses.

stinger.name: Stinger
stinger.description: Smelly candles and fly paper won't save you this time! Stinger mice are on the loose, ready to swarm your cheese. Even with their multiple appendages filled with stolen dairy products, Stinger Mice can attack using their needle tails and acidic saliva, which dissolve cheese, clothing, and many other materials on contact. As far as hunting is concerned, a fly swatter may be the more appropriate weapon, but a mouse trap will do in a pinch.

summer_mage.name: Summer Mage
summer_mage.description: The Summer season on Zugzwang's island is already scorching hot, but the presence of the Summer Mage mouse makes the heat unbearable. Immune to the effects of too much sun, it hurls balls of concentrated summer sunlight at hunters and traps alike. Just one touch of the Summer Mage's sunlight is enough to cause a painful, blistering sunburn, so if you're prone to burns, be sure to take plenty of zinc and aloe with you while hunting.

tanglefoot.name: Tanglefoot
tanglefoot.description: When these mice crafted gloves from a stack of silks that they found in Zugzwang's tower, they soon found that their new duds allowed seeds to grow instantaneously from their paws. Rather than reveling in the gloves' gardening potential, however, Tanglefoot Mice use their powers only to annoy. They grow sharp, rigid Tanglefoot weeds over paths that humans frequent, hindering hunters' movement and shredding light footwear.

vinetail.name: Vinetail
vinetail.description: With prickly fur like the thorns of a wild rose, and a long tail that grows in curlicues, the Vinetail mouse is not a rodent that you want to get your hands on, in the literal sense. Using its root feet for stability, it threads its tail into a trap, then grows a small tendril around the cheese. If the trap puts up a fight, the Vinetail mouse either digs its heels in (literally) and tries to pull the cheese out, or just lets the vine break off so it can grow a new one and try again.

whirleygig.name: Whirleygig
whirleygig.description: Seeking to maximize the benefits of perpetual autumn, the Whirleygig launches itself off maple trees, holding on to the stem of a maple key while it spins around and around. Eventually, the maple key loses momentum, sending the mouse zipping down to the ground, to land with a bump on the base of your trap. This evolution of parachuting strategy sometimes yields cheese, but more often it results in a long drop and a sudden stop, so to speak.

winter_mage.name: Winter Mage
winter_mage.description: Have you ever felt a frosty wind whipping at your coat? If so, you've probably felt the Winter Mage's familiar, that capricious breeze that knocks down trees and roughs up roofs. The winter mage uses its power over the wind to blow the cheese right out of traps, and also to avoid notice. One sharp gust of snow in a hunter's eyes, and they'll be too distracted to see the mouse slipping right under their nose.

living_ice.name: Living Ice
living_ice.description:
Strewn across the Slushy Shoreline are dozens of tiny mouse figurines carefully carved from pure ice. Or at least, that's what it seems. When influenced by the magic of SUPER|brie+, the tiny statues come alive and dive straight for it!

Hunters who search carefully near where they catch a Living Ice Mouse are likely to find icy crafting materials, so keep your eyes peeled!

snow_sniper.name: Snow Sniper
snow_sniper.description:
The Snow Sniper mouse used to have to blindfold himself in order to entice mice into archery matches with him. However, he got so used to shooting blind (and winning!) that he now wears a specially-modified parka that allows him to shoot in his preferred style.

He's never missed a single shot, and has claimed hundreds of pieces of bait in his career, but he's never met Gnawnian hunters before!

ancient_of_the_deep.name: Ancient of the Deep
ancient_of_the_deep.description:
Now long forgotten, from a time before hunters were hunters and the "Town of Gnawnia" was nothing more than a few huts and tents, this ancient terror ruled the depths of the ocean.

Legend states that in the deepest, darkest crevices of the underwater trenches lies dormant one of the most terrifying sea-dwelling mice known to hunters, unfathomably large and more mind-numbingly horrifying than the Deep Mouse.

However unbelievable the tales may be, reports from the King's Far-and-Wide Expedition Team (FAWET) show that something has responded to the rumbling engines of recent expeditions into the Rodentia Ocean. This long-forgotten Old One has begun to stir, and its first order of business is to find those responsible for disturbing its slumber!

angelfish.name: Angelfish
angelfish.description:
Their translucent body allows them to hide among their surroundings unnoticed. Special reflective scales provide additional camouflage from its predators and potential prey.

Don't let these looks fool you! Her natural defences help her stay safe and give her an edge to ambush potential prey.

angler.name: Angler
angler.description:
This extremely poor hunter has evolved some pretty exciting traits. Almost completely blind, the Angler Mouse uses a light-emitting feeler to help him see in the dark waters and allow him to read at night, keeping his mind sharp if the time ever comes for him to use it. Sharp talons not only protrude from his hands, but all over his body to allow him to catch prey at any angle. Most of his meals are acquired by pure accident!

His gigantic tail fin gives him the ability to keep up with his "friends" with minimal effort, making it useful for catching up to prey, considering it looks like this particular Angler Mouse hasn't been eating too much...

But don't let his scrawny figure fool you! Remember, accidents happen!

barnacle_beautician.name: Barnacle Beautician
barnacle_beautician.description: Scouring the deep for the most beautiful of Barnacles, this beautician loves the look and feel of freshly-formed Barnacle shells, moulding and shaping them into fine jewelry and accessories. Always on the lookout, her eyes just light up whenever she spots a particularly pretty bunch or a new candidate to become part of her latest fashions.

barracuda.name: Barracuda
barracuda.description:
The lone wolf of the ocean. Once fully-grown, the Barracuda Mouse separates himself from the pack, fearless and strong enough to sustain himself on his own.

Be wary if you see them in pairs or more: They will hunt in packs when they plan on taking out bigger quarry.

betta.name: Betta
betta.description: An ancient fish found in the deeper parts of the ocean.  Incredibly strong and agile.  He has evolved into the perfect deep sea hunter.

bottom_feeder.name: Bottom Feeder
bottom_feeder.description: This mouse slowly crawls along the ocean floor, scrounging for scraps of anything that could resemble food.  It moves so slowly that Barnacles easily form along this mouse's leathery hide.

carnivore.name: Carnivore
carnivore.description:
The Carnivore Mouse is a ruthless, insatiable and relentless predator. Being known to hunt even its own kind when food becomes scarce sets this beast apart from the other ocean monsters.

This mouse is one of the many terrors that haunt the dreams of sailors and explorers and of those that dare to hunt in the deep sea.

Remember, hunter: Venturing too deep has its consequences...

city_noble.name: City Noble
city_noble.description:
The high society of the Sunken City. Prim, proper and poised, these nobles are ready at a moment's notice to take up arms against any who challenge them. Trained in the art of fencing, constantly battling for their status inside the city, the City Noble Mouse is a respectable member of the oceanic occupants.

This mouse is no stranger to The Duel. You better be at your best when you step toe-to-toe with a City Noble Mouse!

city_worker.name: City Worker
city_worker.description: Model citizen, strong and hardworking.  Raising his fist in acknowledgement of the local 513 energy workers, he does his part to keep the city in clean, working order.

clownfish.name: Clownfish
clownfish.description: Always clowning around, this jester of the sea lives to make everyone laugh! Unfortunately, leaving others to be the butt of his many jokes, he is mostly lonely and no one ever takes him seriously!

clumsy_carrier.name: Clumsy Carrier
clumsy_carrier.description: The main mice in charge of supplying the City Worker mice with materials.  Less fit than their city-working counterparts and often falling behind schedule, these guys are under so much stress that they constantly make mistakes and suffer premature greying of the hair.  That's the price of rapid expansion and technological development!

coral_cuddler.name: Coral Cuddler
coral_cuddler.description: The cute little Coral Cuddler constantly coseys up to colourful coral patches. Having coral-like outcroppings on its own back allows it to camouflage and hide from other deep sea predators.  He likes to keep the coral close for comfort and safety!

coral_dragon.name: Coral Dragon
coral_dragon.description: A mighty beast from the deep!  A dragon with strong, hardened sea scales resembling coral. The scales help the dragon blend in with its surroundings to make hunting and hiding easier, and they also offer a strong resistance to the dangers of the ocean! But what would something this big need to hide from...?

coral_gardener.name: Coral Gardener
coral_gardener.description: Completely green except for her thumbs! Her desperate attempts at growing her own coral beds to spruce things up constantly fail miserably! It could have something to do with applying conventional land-based gardening tips for plants to try to grow living coral organisms... It's just not the same! Someone should really buy her better DIY materials.

coral_guard.name: Coral Guard
coral_guard.description: Stalwart and steadfast, the Coral Guard Mouse keeps watch over the Coral Castle, keeping unwanted visitors and hunters in check. So devoted and unwavering is his guard that Barnacles and Damaged Coral Fragments sometimes grow and collect upon his body! Talk about taking your job seriously!

coral_harvester.name: Coral Harvester
coral_harvester.description: A diligent worker, gathering coral from nearby reefs.  Coral is used for most of the working materials on the ocean floor.  The softer corals are also a main source of food, albeit not that tasty, for those under the sea.

coral.name: Coral
coral.description:
Hidden among the coral, this mouse preys upon those that wander a little too close. Using her beauty along with her hypnotic dance, she sways the coral around her in an effort to lull and attract her unsuspecting victims.

Talk about fatal attraction!

coral_queen.name: Coral Queen
coral_queen.description: Prim and proper, the Coral Queen Mouse is carefully selected and groomed to rule.  An empress regnant who reigns over the Coral Castle empire of the Rodentia Ocean.  Her subjects work diligently to help their coral empire expand and flourish along the sea floor.

crabolia.name: Crabolia
crabolia.description:
Hidden within its thick shell, the Crabolia Mouse keeps to himself as he crawls along the more shallow areas of the ocean. Slowly and steadily, like the current, he trawls the seabed looking for food and warm places to rest.

Don't let his gentle nature fool you, he has tremendous strength hidden within those cute little claws of his if he feels threatened.

cuttle.name: Cuttle
cuttle.description:
One of the more adorable denizens of the deep. The Cuttle Mouse is incredibly curious and interested in all of the wonders to behold beneath the surface of the ocean.

But as the saying goes: Curiosity sets off the trap...

deep_sea_diver.name: Deep Sea Diver
deep_sea_diver.description:
A courageous sea explorer! Risking life and limb to explore the depths for all of mousekind! Fascinated with what lies beneath the deep, him and his team of explorers trawl the ocean floor looking for unexplored sunken history. Finding the odd treasure here and there is also a big plus!

By using antiquated diving equipment, it saves him from having to pass emissions testing imposed on newer diving gear.

deranged_deckhand.name: Deranged Deckhand
deranged_deckhand.description:
Part of an unsavoury crew of pirate mice that used to sail the seas long, long ago. Something just wouldn't let these mice rest down under in Casey Jones' Closet and now they are looking for others to join them!

This is one crew you do not want to be apart of.

derpshark.name: Derpshark
derpshark.description:
An eccentric type of fish, totally oblivious to everything in the ocean, even foregoing eating and sleeping if something shiny happens to catch their eye. You know when one is nearby based on its whale-like howls and echoing cries (it thinks it's a whale).

Long and loud howls can be heard wherever Derpsharks congregate. There is nothing to fear, however, as they are relatively harmless to others. But it is wise to keep your distance when they gather, because they might not notice you nearby and overwhelm you with their massive crowd!

dread_piratert.name: Dread Piratert
dread_piratert.description: A legendary pirate who strikes fear into all of his foes for he takes no prisoners. Some believe he is immortal, others suggest such a thing inconceivable and state that he is merely different mice playing up a pseudonym. Whatever the case, we know he is in the pirating business for all the sweet Barnacles! Or was it to rescue Princess Barnacle? No wait... Well, anyway, if you catch this mouse you probably won't be able to get him to talk... or was that to get him to STOP talking...? Either way, you will have the upper hand because we know he is left-handed! ...Probably!

eel.name: Eel
eel.description:
Slippery and slimy! Loves to burrow down into the mud and sand in the deeper areas of the ocean. Accustomed to the deep, they have developed a phosphorus glow produced by running a self-generated electric current through their glass-like fins.

This current is also used for self-defence. Other deep sea mice familiar with their eerie green glow tend to keep their distance for fear of getting shocked, again!

elite_guardian.name: Elite Guardian
elite_guardian.description: Highly-trained guard that is sworn to protect the citizens of the once lost Sunken City. More importantly, to protect their most precious commodity: Oxygen! These guards keep a wary eye about for those looking to grab a little more than their allocated stipend.

enginseer.name: Enginseer
enginseer.description:
The most brilliant mice below sea level. The Enginseer uses ancient wisdom, technology and magic to develop and harmonize the advanced systems and machinery used within the incredible Sunken City.

They are seen as the very heart and soul that really make the Sunken City come alive!

guppy.name: Guppy
guppy.description:
A very social aquatic mouse! So adept at talking that the Guppy Mouse has learned to live without closing its mouth! Makes eating and talking a lot easier, and a lot more gross. This is the mouse to turn to for all the latest gossip and hottest underwater fashion trends!

Do you like seefood?

hydrologist.name: Hydrologist
hydrologist.description:
The Hydrologists have made the impossible possible! With their advanced understandings and study of water, they have made the idea of an underwater habitat a reality!

In charge of keeping the homeostasis of the Sunken City, they work diligently to keep everything running smoothly.

jellyfish.name: Jellyfish
jellyfish.description: The ballerina of the sea!  Floating majestically throughout the depths, she mesmerizes onlookers with her soft glow and flowing gelatinous gown.  But beware of her tentacles! They act as toxin-filled drift nets, capturing prey as they idly float by, enamoured by her spectacular performance.

koimaid.name: Koimaid
koimaid.description: Brightly-coloured and always smiling, the gentle Koimaid Mouse has a soft spot for all of the smaller aquatic creatures in the ocean. She dedicates her time to caring for and helping raise all of the little ones like a second mother and does her best to keep them out of trouble.

manatee.name: Manatee
manatee.description:
Slow and sleepy: The two defining characteristics of the Manatee Mouse. If he's not asleep, he's drifting towards something to eat. Eventually.

Never in a rush, he goes where the current takes him.

mermousette.name: Mermousette
mermousette.description:
A hidden jewel of unimaginable beauty hidden within the depths of the ocean. Many myths and legends surround this fabled angel of the ocean, fueling the drive for many a mouse and hunter to brave the rugged seas just to catch a glimpse of her!

It is believed that anyone lucky enough to catch a mermaid would then know true love!

mershark.name: Mershark
mershark.description:
"Crafty, cunning and cutthroat, the Mershark Mouse is an incredibly efficient and equally-terrifying hunter of the deep. Sharing the same deep blue hue as the ocean itself gives this mouse unparalleled camouflage and stalking abilities.

You won't know the Mershark Mouse is upon you until it's too late!"

mlounder_flounder.name: Mlounder Flounder
mlounder_flounder.description: These little guys love to get into all kinds of trouble!  Fearless and endlessly curious, they get into everything!  They love the warmer waters closer to the surface and thrive off of sunlight.  Their lesser known ability to camouflage makes them harder to find than one would think.

octomermaid.name: Octomermaid
octomermaid.description:
The sinister sister of the mermice of the sea. Loves the deeper and darker parts of the ocean as she believes it helps keep her pale green complexion. Her lips contain a powerful paralyzing venom, giving her one unforgettable kiss!

Easily mistaken for a Mermousette Mouse above the surface, she uses this guise to bring more than one mousy sailor to their doom! Those poor unfortunate souls!

old_one.name: Old One
old_one.description:
Believed to be an ancient wizard from long ago that lost a duel resulting in a terrible transformation and banishment to the ocean deep. Now with nothing left but time, he focuses his abilities and trains his magics.

There is a saying among seafaring hunters: "When the storms are here, the Old One is near."

oxygen_baron.name: Oxygen Baron
oxygen_baron.description:
The Oxygen Baron Mouse exemplifies the characteristics of any successful crime lord: Greed, lust for power, and insatiable gluttony! This corrupt mayor of the Sunken City is obsessed with stockpiling their most valuable resource. Constantly abusing his power by controlling the city's Oxygen supply, he unscrupulously allocates unlimited quantities for his own personal use, leaving those in need of the resource in dire straits.

He who controls the Oxygen controls the city!

pearl_diver.name: Pearl Diver
pearl_diver.description:
A precious mouse seeking precious pearls. He snorkels searching for a pearl that is just as unique as he is. There is something about their pearly texture that just makes it feel like everything is right in the ocean!

Pearl Diver, he's been down too long in the midnight sea. His friends wonder what is becoming of him. Shiny pearls, white and yellowish colour in hue, the Pearl Diver is coming for you!

pearl.name: Pearl
pearl.description:
One of the wealthiest of the ocean-dwelling mice, she is highly sought after by collectors for her special assortment of rare and beautiful pearls. Her body is adorned with permanent jewelry made from the pearls she collects. Some question whether she found these pearls or produced them from her very skin!

She usually keeps a huge spare pearl or two around to tempt those that try to come for her to take it instead!

pirate_anchor.name: Pirate Anchor
pirate_anchor.description:
Avast, ye landlubbers!

This dutiful pirate bears the most dangerous job of all, the treasure lookout! Whenever the pirate crew of a ship deem there to be treasure about, this pirate goes down with the anchor and takes a quick look!

puffer.name: Puffer
puffer.description: Consisting of extremely elastic skin, the Puffer Mouse can easily fill its body up with surrounding water and puff up to a much larger size. This defence mechanism is great for thwarting potential predators but it also is an attractant to hunters who, for a long time, were fooled into thinking they were much heavier mice than they actually are!

saltwater_axolotl.name: Saltwater Axolotl
saltwater_axolotl.description: Friendly, curious and boy are they ever energetic!  The Axolotl forever remains in his child-like state.  It loves to play and meet new friends.  With quick, explosive movement they are quite difficult to keep up with.

sand_dollar_diver.name: Sand Dollar Diver
sand_dollar_diver.description: Mice looking for newly found wealth and riches dive in search of the mysterious Sand Dollar. Used as currency within the Sunken City, they collect and hoard them in hopes of one day being able to live the good life!

sand_dollar_queen.name: Sand Dollar Queen
sand_dollar_queen.description: This mouse is quite the catch if you can find her. Word is, she used to serve fish at the local sand bar until she sashayed her way into a large cache of Sand Dollars during a fashion contest. With her winnings she has taken up a new life of sharing her impressive style sense, teaching others that you’ve got to work for your dreams and the important truth that if you can’t love yourself how are you going to love anybody else?

school_of_mish.name: School of Mish
school_of_mish.description: Flocking together like underwater birds of a feather, Mish mice go everywhere together!  Never seen in anything less than pairs, these mice rely heavily on strength in numbers!  Never too far from one another, they can easily swarm in the hundreds to help another in need!

seadragon.name: Seadragon
seadragon.description:
The Seadragon Mouse is named after its dragon-like appearance, though it lacks the imposing physique of a true dragon. Fairly small in size, the Seadragon Mouse enjoys life along the bottom of most sea banks, mostly floating and drifting, using their tails to anchor themselves in the more interesting parts of the ocean.

They have long, leaf-like appendages which help them blend in with the local flora. This also makes them exceptionally well suited at peek-a-boo and hide-and-seek!

serpent_monster.name: Serpent Monster
serpent_monster.description: Hidden among the outcroppings, burrows and other dark nooks and crannies within the deep, the Serpent Monster Mouse slithers up on their unsuspecting prey out in the dark, swallowing it whole! Their long, sharp teeth act mostly like confining prison bars that prevent the swallowed prey from escaping their life sentence. Yuck!

spear_fisher.name: Spear Fisher
spear_fisher.description:
Believed to be the remaining members of an ancient and advanced underwater civilization of mice. They were once technologically advanced and living peacefully in their own aquatic civilization until something reduced that civilization to complete ruin.

Having now lost their city and advanced technologies, they are reduced to spearfishing, instead of industrialized farming, to gather food.

stingray.name: Stingray
stingray.description:
The kite of the sea! Swims through the ocean with such little resistance that it looks as though it glides and floats underwater. They are also very curious, tailing interesting things (mice and hunters alike) around for hours on end!

When threatened, they dive bomb into the seabed and hide among the agitated sand. They have an impressive and deadly barbed stinger, luckily used only in self-defence.

sunken_banshee.name: Sunken Banshee
sunken_banshee.description:
Legend states this to be a fairy who has taken on the form of a mousy apparition. The Sunken Banshee Mouse floats through the ocean, looking to warn those at sea of impending danger.

Despite her haunting figure, her soft-glowing eyes calm even the fiercest beasts and bring courage to the frightened. Seen as a good omen by sailors and pirates alike.

sunken_citizen.name: Sunken Citizen
sunken_citizen.description: One of the many citizens of the Sunken City.  Helps out with the everyday construction and maintenance by supplying the workers with much needed materials and lending a hand when needed.

swashblade.name: Swashblade
swashblade.description:
Not to be confused with a swashbuckler, the Swashblade Mouse fights for her own personal gain. Usually along side a pirate crew, she is the first line of offence and makes sure her frontline crew are the first to get paid!

These spirits are usually unable to rest until they have received payment for a job well done.

tadpole.name: Tadpole
tadpole.description:
A tadpole is usually the infant state of amphibian lifeforms. The Tadpole Mouse is a unique exception where it matures into a bigger tadpole with arms and legs, never shedding its tail!

Now fully formed, it's free to explore the underwater world without too much worry from its previous predators.

treasure_hoarder.name: Treasure Hoarder
treasure_hoarder.description:
The Treasure Hoarder Mouse seeks out the shiniest of shiny, the most precious of preciouses to adorn on its body. These mice cover themselves in shiny, valuable objects in order to attract potential partners. When a male meets a female, they compare looks and potential overall wealth to determine if they are fit for one another.

You better hope they don't beat you to some treasure! It's extremely difficult to remove treasure from them once they've gathered it up and affixed it to their naturally sticky scales.

treasure_keeper.name: Treasure Keeper
treasure_keeper.description:
The strongest and most disciplined Treasure Hoarder mice are hired on as Treasure Keeper mice for the Coral Queen. The keeper collects and keeps safe all of the treasures that are found in the ocean for his majesty.

Being paid handsomely, it is also the easiest way to come across vast amounts of treasure, making his life a lot easier if he is strong enough to fend off the other hoarders!

tritus.name: Tritus
tritus.description:
The apex predator of the deep. The whispered king of the Rodentia Ocean. Tall tales and forgotten fables lend to the mysteries about this mouse. Only the oldest, most-hardened and extremely eccentric hunters from the Harbour dare whisper the name of the mighty Tritus.

Take heed: Those that dare to seek this mythical beast must be prepared!

turret_guard.name: Turret Guard
turret_guard.description:
Hired guns for the Coral Castle to halt invaders and fend off bigger, more hostile aquatic mice. The terrestrial mice outside of the ocean have developed advanced weaponry which is exceptional at hunting underwater. Mice who stumble across this job opening usually leap at the chance. The guard duty is light and the pay is quite heavy!

Although they bring a lot of their own gear with them from the surface, developing new technologies underwater has its difficulties and these mice have to innovate from time to time!

urchin_king.name: Urchin King
urchin_king.description:
Many tales travel the tides of the Rodentia Ocean and this mouse is the centre of one of them. It is believed that the Old One had struck a bargain with one of the Coral Kings of old, offering untold riches and glory for a price. No one knows what the price was or if it was indeed paid but it appears that the Coral King's disappearance is linked with the appearance of Urchin Kings.

These mice prefer to be alone and are easily angered. Approach with caution as they are highly poisonous to the touch!

big_bad_burroughs.name: Big Bad Burroughs
big_bad_burroughs.description: Even with all of the wisdom of the Laboratory scientists at their disposal, the town of Digby is scrambling to deal with all the cave-ins, punctures and ground tremors caused by the 'Triple B'. Where this mouse goes, a trail of churned-up earth follows, collapsing anything sitting on top of it, and because it pulls all of its cheesy victims underground, the Big Bad Burroughs mouse very seldom needs to show its head above the earth's surface. . . but when it does, you know it's angry.

core_sample.name: Core Sample
core_sample.description: The Digby scientists routinely take samples from the rocks surrounding their home, hoping to catch any emerging mouse tunnels that might be around. One day, as the scientists examined one of their latest samples, ears popped out of the top like folded sails, and a tail fell down from its bottom. It blinked and twitched its nose. Rumor has it that the geologist in question stomped on his hat and left the job site soon after this incident, saying: "Now they're everywhere."

demolitions.name: Demolitions
demolitions.description: Judged by the other mice to be too overzealous with the explosives to help with tunneling operations, Demolitions Mice blow trap mechanisms using piles of home-made dynamite that they place strategically along weak points. How do they make dynamite using the kinds of materials that mice typically get their hands on? Well, the recipe happens to be a closely guarded trade secret. If they told you, they'd have to pin a tail on you and cover you with fluff.

industrious_digger.name: Industrious Digger
industrious_digger.description: The Industrious Digger mice weren't always as industrious as their name suggests-- in fact, they used to be the biggest pack of slackers in all of Gnawnia. The Diggers even used to steal cheese from other mice, until someone convinced them that they could get rich quick by digging up gold. Sooner or later they'll figure out that they're working for a living, and that there's no buried gold at Digby, but in the meantime, the other mice are having a lot of fun laughing at them.

itty-bitty_burroughs.name: Itty-Bitty Burroughs
itty-bitty_burroughs.description: Similar to their big brother, the Big Bad Burroughs mouse, but smaller and cuter, Itty-Bitty Burroughs mice pop up everywhere in Digby-- which explains why many residents have taken to carrying mallets around with them on a daily basis. Itty-Bitties use their drill-like mouth to propel them underground, which means that one minute, they're snatching a forbidden piece of cheese, and the next they've disappeared down a tunnel too small for human hands.

lambent_crystal.name: Lambent Crystal
lambent_crystal.description: The tunnels below Digby are a dark and scary place for some mice, which is why these magical mice have adapted to emit a romantic purple glow designed to make hunters a little more compassionate towards them. If you suddenly feel the urge to join the NVMRC, don't worry; it's perfectly normal.

miner.name: Miner
miner.description: Digby may be full of researchers and engineers, but it's the Miner Mice who have refined cheese theft down to a science. The drills on the front of their vehicles (known affectionately among the scientists as 'Trap Trashers'), allow Miners to penetrate to even the most secure subterranean chamber. Once they reach the area in question, the drills double as a trap destruction device, while the precision pincer arm reaches in to nab the cheese.

nugget.name: Nugget
nugget.description: Nugget mice never grow very big, and are not very good at getting anywhere fast. When the other mice were handing out jobs, they decided the Nuggets were no competition for the likes of the Big Bad Burroughs clan. After all, Nuggets can't smash or bend or bury anything. . .  and yet, the little Nuggets lead a peaceful life, gathering little bits of things that they find on the ground and hoping that they might prove useful. They're fond of shiny beetle shells, and like to form collections.

rock_muncher.name: Rock Muncher
rock_muncher.description: With a stomach full of rocks, these mice are not often seen moving quickly. Slow and slightly dim-witted, these mice lumber around the tunnels of Digby looking for tasty pieces of stone, occasionally shouting, with a full mouth, "Nom, nom... This rock tasty!".

stone_cutter.name: Stone Cutter
stone_cutter.description: When it comes to living underground, mice without a means of breaking through bedrock, quite literally, don't get very far. Some other, more infamous mice just chew their way through the rocks, but not all mice are lucky enough to have multiple jaws and thousands of teeth. No, some mice have to equip themselves with really good power tools, thankyouverymuch. Some mice put in a hard day's labor to rob a trap, rather than just zipping around eating granite.

subterranean.name: Subterranean
subterranean.description: After being run out of their laboratory, the scientists of Digby took refuge deep in the earth, hoping to wait out the mouse invasion. Shortly after digging in for the long haul, they found that the mice had taken over everything, including underground, which forced them to bring their drill city back to the surface. Now, by using their experience below ground,  and a special irradiated crystal cheese, the cleverest hunters have been able to attract these deep digging mice.

biohazard.name: Biohazard
biohazard.description:
Mix, Mix, Swirl, Mix! This environmental activist tries tirelessly to create a concoction capable of curing the colossal calamity that has occurred! Unfortunately, due to his complete lack of knowledge of chemical compounds and complex caustic combinations, he does way more harm than good!

At least he has the common sense to cover completely in conservational custodial clothing!

bog_beast.name: Bog Beast
bog_beast.description: Highly irradiated, the Bog Beast Mouse has developed a penchant to smother himself in the nearby polluted, slimy bog.  The muddy slime soothes the Bog Beast's skin, bringing his body and core temperatures back to a more normal level.  Be careful wandering through the polluted bog at the Toxic Spill, that pile of mud might not be what you think!

gelatinous_octahedron.name: Gelatinous Octahedron
gelatinous_octahedron.description: Gelanium is a useless, dangerous chemical that results from the overuse of Type-R lasers in the various experiments carried out in the Laboratory. Mice who consume this chemical find themselves becoming a part of it. You are what you eat, after all!

hazmat.name: Hazmat
hazmat.description:
With a single tear in their eye from gazing upon the huge toxic mess, Hazmat mice make it their mission to don their suits and cleaning apparel and chant the song of their people...

Hi-ho, hi-ho, it's off to clean we go! With a mop and pail, we will prevail! Hi-ho! Hi-ho, hi-ho. Hi-ho, hi-ho, it's off to clean we go! We'll clean this mess, you'll be impressed! Hi-ho, hi-ho!

lab_technician.name: Lab Technician
lab_technician.description:
Contaminated but still completely devoted to the clean, the Lab Technician Mouse does his best with what he has to work with! Since he has already been exposed to the toxic elements, he just grabs whatever is left in the cleaning closet and makes the most of it!

He should be alright as long as he rinses off a little afterwards, right?

monster_tail.name: Monster Tail
monster_tail.description:
While out picking flowers, this cuddly little one seems to have fused with some local flora. Not particularly harmful on her own, she enjoys wandering the wasteland, discovering newly mutated plants to pick. But watch out for her tail: It has quite the painful bite!

Don't let her overall cute exterior distract you from her dangerous posterior!

mutant_mongrel.name: Mutant Mongrel
mutant_mongrel.description:
Caught off guard while frolicking nearby, this mouse was covered in a layer of Crude Pollutinum and raw Chromate spill-off from recent trap experimentation, mutating him by drastically increasing his size. If that wasn't enough, the fusion of Crude Pollutinum and Chromate has crystallized and formed a hardened shell over most of his body.

Luckily, he has retained his playful nature and continues to frolic about, mostly minding his own business... Wait, maybe that's not so lucky...

mutant_ninja.name: Mutant Ninja
mutant_ninja.description:
A few of Furoma's finest ninja mice seem to have been also caught off guard while training nearby. While being agile enough to avoid most of the toxins and spillage, the small amount they were exposed to looks to have increased their body mass and speed while also providing excellent nightvision!

The piles of old clothing scraps near the spill location ended up absorbing the sludge, turning them green, which they quickly adopted as their new uniform. With the added strength and agility, they are also able to keep multiple weapons handy on them at all times, such as chainsticks, long staffs, prong-shaped metal batons, and short swords.

Even after discovering the secret of the ooze and gaining new powers, they are still humble warriors who never forget the wise words of their master: "Remember who you are."

mutated_behemoth.name: Mutated Behemoth
mutated_behemoth.description:
This is him, the mouse that started it all. Caught on camera at ground zero, near the state-of-the-art filtration system. From within the Laboratory, he followed his nose through the complex system of pipes and passages towards the major outflow filter... which was covered with Radioactive Blue cheese runoff! He had escaped from his containment at the Laboratory and was searching desperately for food.

That heavenly "blue cheese" filter probably looked like the biggest piece of cheese this tiny little one had ever seen! Without a moment's hesitation, he began to chew through the whole filtration system! Full of harmful chemicals, toxins and the King knows what else, once destroyed there was nothing left to stop the contaminated outflow!

This mouse continued eating and eating and growing and eating as he was pushed out through the tunnel, unable to stop! The radiation and toxins drastically increased his size and appetite! The King fears that this mouse, now insatiable and of epic proportions, will never be stopped if the pollution isn't cleaned up soon...

mutated_siblings.name: Mutated Siblings
mutated_siblings.description:
What do you get when you take two brothers fighting over a piece of cheese and throw some toxic waste into the mix? A mutant pair of siblings, of course!

Preoccupied with who gets the first bite of the prized cheese they just stole, they failed to take note of the rapidly-developing toxic wave encroaching on their feud. When all was said and done, the two became one!

outbreak_assassin.name: Outbreak Assassin
outbreak_assassin.description: Cracked and corrupted, the Outbreak Assassin Mouse has obtained the ability to control the state of sludge while he is in contact with it. Abandoning conventional weaponry for his own vorpal blades, this mouse makes a weapon out of his own body and the environment.  Like others in the area, they will stop at nothing to preserve their new-found power.

plague_hag.name: Plague Hag
plague_hag.description: Attracted by the copious amounts of pollution and fast-spreading rumors of "extraordinary" powers, the Plague Hag Mouse has come to incorporate the toxins and pollution into her craft. She brews a secret concoction of poisons, hoping to unlock the answers hidden deep within in the sludge, making herself all-powerful!

scrap_metal_monster.name: Scrap Metal Monster
scrap_metal_monster.description: Ingenious devices of death and destruction!  They seem to have been created with bits and pieces of scrap metal from the Laboratory's toxic outflow as defense units to preserve the toxic spill.  It is currently unknown who or what has created these Scrap Metal Monster mice!

slimefist.name: Slimefist
slimefist.description: Digging through this strange, slimey substance has caused abnormal growth, localized mainly in the hands and claws.  Now, armed with REAL Kung fu grip, fists as hard as stone and claws that could shred through toxic barrels like a MonstroBot through the Meadow, the Slimefist Mouse packs quite the punch!

sludge.name: Sludge
sludge.description: Bubbling boils of toxic brew strangely dot the hide of this unpredictable mouse.  Rapidly absorbing toxins through his skin, he has become one of the most poisonous in the area.  Even the slightest touch can make one extremely ill, not to mention the stench! Phew!

sludge_soaker.name: Sludge Soaker
sludge_soaker.description: This is the kinda guy that likes to "go with the flow" of things.  One of the first to come to accept the pollution, the Sludge Soaker Mouse can be found relaxing about and enjoying his new habitat.  Partial to the warm, glowing feeling that fresh toxic ooze provides, he figures why fight it?

sludge_swimmer.name: Sludge Swimmer
sludge_swimmer.description: Tiny but deadly, this guy's toxic bite could drop even those with the strongest constitution in mere seconds. Only the highest ranked hunters are tasked with hunting these excessively dangerous mice.

spore.name: Spore
spore.description: Spelunking in a nearby cave, this happy explorer of a mouse had no idea as to what had just happened outside.  On his way out he noticed that the cave fungi were glowing exceptionally bright.  Irradiated by toxic fungus, this spelunker now glows in the dark, making his exploring much easier!  Also, as an added bonus, he doesn't have to go too far to find new and rare mushrooms!  I don't think he could be any happier!

swamp_runner.name: Swamp Runner
swamp_runner.description: Making the best of a bad situation, the Swamp Runner Mouse is a resident of the local area that has quickly adapted to the newly altered environment.  Using whatever he can scavenge to keep to his daily routine, he's perfectly at home in the untamed swamp!

telekinetic_mutant.name: Telekinetic Mutant
telekinetic_mutant.description: The high toxins in the area have bestowed toxic telekinetic abilities to this mouse.  Able to telekinetically move and shift everything that has been affected by pollution, she uses her new-found power to protect herself and her mutated allies.  Crafting herself a suit out of contaminated safety rubber and sealant, she takes to the contaminated area as a superheroine to fight for the mice of this new wasteland!

tentacle.name: Tentacle
tentacle.description: While out relaxing on the beach, this mouse absorbed a little more than just some sun!  Covered in a flash flood of toxic chemicals, this mouse developed tentacles, replacing her hair and covering her in a nice green toxic glow.  Not quite the tan she was looking for...

the_menace.name: The Menace
the_menace.description:
With unknown origins, the Menace Mouse seems to be a victim of circumstance. This mouse started appearing shortly after the spills started and is believed to be the direct result of the initial environmental shock caused by the pollution, leading to an immediate and violent mutation.

Once mutated, this mouse grows in size, strength and attitude in a matter of minutes! Clearly angered by what has happened to his home, he smashes through the piles of refuse, looking for anything and everything to destroy, fuelled by raw anger amplified by the nearby radiation.

Best to stay clear and not to anger him any further. You wouldn't like him when he's angry...

toxic_warrior.name: Toxic Warrior
toxic_warrior.description:
A lone, hardened warrior that wanders the wasteland, the Toxic Warrior Mouse uses her training and survival instincts to minimize the effects of pollution on her body. She uses the toxins to her advantage, incorporating them into her weaponry and body to make her an even more effective combatant. If she doesn't get you, the toxins in her body will!

Rumors of an ancient, hidden vault sunk deep within the toxic bog bring her and other warriors like her to this hazardous mess, ignoring the risks for a chance at a great reward!

hope.name: Hope
hope.description: The Hope Mouse is altruistic by nature, wanting only to help others, be they human or mouse.  The King has been so touched by the selflessness of these mice that he has sent out a decree.  If any hunter should catch a Hope Mouse, dust him off and send him on his way, as he's likely off to do some good in the world.

dumpling_chef.name: Dumpling Chef
dumpling_chef.description: With hard work, commitment to using only the finest ingredients, and an impressive sense of balance, the Dumpling Chef Mouse makes its living cooking dumplings for the bewhiskered masses. It serves thousands of dumplings a day to hungry travelers, filled with seasoned grass, wheat seeds, and, plenty of cheese, of course. The most popular of its dumplings is the Furoma Firecracker, filled with cheddar, provolone, and an extra-spicy monterey jack!

barkshell.name: Barkshell
barkshell.description: By harnessing the power of Garden Essences, the Barkshell mouse has been able to merge with and grow a strong outer layer of bark, protecting him from both the elements and anyone who would want to cause trouble.

camofusion.name: Camofusion
camofusion.description: Instead of using home-made camouflage to avoid predators, the Camofusion Mouse has absorbed and grown her own camouflage to better attract and entrap her targets.  Scarier still, the multitude of tendrils growing on her back are sensitive to movement and sound, allowing her to track down her prey with ease.

dehydrated.name: Dehydrated
dehydrated.description: Constantly seeking liquid, never able to get quite enough, the Dehydrated Mouse can only be lured out of hiding if sufficient moisture soaks the nearby area.  But until he can find such a paradise, he is doomed to wander, lonely and dry.

fungal_spore.name: Fungal Spore
fungal_spore.description:
You might not think the power to sprout mushrooms on command would be very impressive, but you'd be very wrong, because with that power comes the ability to shoot acidic spores in a cloud with a wide radius.

Several hunters' traps have been found half-dissolved as a result of this mouse.

shattered_carmine.name: Shattered Carmine
shattered_carmine.description:
Carmine was once a simple mouse who only sought to help her fellow kind. Deep within the Living Garden, she found a source of unimaginable power and has abused it nearly to the point of losing herself completely. It is hard to tell if she even exists on a physical level anymore, and almost seems to have become one with the sinister energies.

If she is left to widen the Rift between our worlds, the sheer destruction that would be wrought could spell the end of everything. Though it seems an impossible task, she must be stopped before she can complete her task!

thorn.name: Thorn
thorn.description: What predators would ever willingly try to bite a mouse covered in spikes and thorns?  The Thorn mouse has never met any, or at least, none that have tried twice.

twisted_carmine.name: Twisted Carmine
twisted_carmine.description:
Like the other mice of this twisted dimension, Carmine has abused the power of the Garden Essences to twist and empower herself -- not an ability a simple apothecary should have! Further, it is obvious that she is the one holding open the Rift between the worlds, and it is growing ever-larger by the day.

Simple traps and straightforward hunters won't be enough to distract her from her task. Only the most dedicated hunters who are able to amass powerful enough Garden Essences and shape them to their own ends will have a hope of uncovering her true goals and stopping her!

twisted_hotcakes.name: Twisted Hotcakes
twisted_hotcakes.description: Who needs a peppergun when you can summon flames with the power of your mind?  Hotcakes remains helpful and is more than happy to help you re-heat any cold food you might have, but be very careful - her aim isn't very good and if she starts laughing while aiming, you might just want to run!

twisted_lilly.name: Twisted Lilly
twisted_lilly.description: After fusing with Garden Essences, this mouse became less carefree and happy and more terrifying and brutal.  Anyone and anything that gets in her way is swiftly knocked aside with telekinetic powers, with no regard given to what or who may be in the way.

bloomed_sylvan.name: Bloomed Sylvan
bloomed_sylvan.description: The ancient rift ancestor of the Sylvan Mouse in full bloom! They are quite scarce and skittish making them difficult to spot amongst the forest and foliage.  Once the flower on the tip of their tail opens and their facial blossoms bloom this mouse becomes quite a rare sight to behold!
bloomed_sylvan.cheese: Brie String, Magical String, Marble String, Swiss String

centaur_ranger.name: Centaur Ranger
centaur_ranger.description:
The mighty Centaur Ranger Mouse, Warrior of the Whisker Woods. The hand of justice for those who wander too close to the heart of the forest without welcome. One would do well to avoid upsetting this silent watcher.
